security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no code execution capability. Shell scripts referenced are templates for deployment automation. All network calls go through documented MCP tools to legitimate Flow Nexus API endpoints.

low_findings.title: Shell script execution patterns
low_findings.description: The skill contains shell script templates for deployment automation. These are standard devops practices but represent code execution capability. Scripts like deploy-app.sh (lines 546-571) and ops-util.sh (lines 787-821) use bash commands. This is legitimate for a platform management skill but could be misused if modified.

content.value_statement: Flow Nexus provides cloud sandboxes, storage, databases, and deployment services. This skill automates authentication, sandbox creation, application deployment, monitoring, and billing management for the Flow Nexus platform.
actual_capabilities: Register and authenticate users with Flow Nexus platform
Create and configure development sandboxes with E2B
Deploy applications from templates or custom code
Monitor system health, logs, and metrics
Configure storage buckets and database schemas
Manage billing, credits, and auto-refill settings
limitations: Requires Flow Nexus MCP server installation
Limited to services offered by Flow Nexus platform
Credit balance required for sandbox and deployment usage
Cannot access other cloud platforms directly

use_cases.title: Automate cloud infrastructure
use_cases.description: Set up development environments, deploy applications, and configure monitoring automatically

use_cases.title: Deploy web applications
use_cases.description: Deploy Next.js, Node.js, and other templates to cloud sandboxes with one command

use_cases.title: Manage platform operations
use_cases.description: Monitor system health, track usage, configure alerts, and handle billing centrally

prompt_templates.title: Setup Flow Nexus
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Flow Nexus platform skill to register a new account and authenticate. Set up the platform configuration and create a development sandbox.

prompt_templates.title: Deploy Application
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy a Next.js application to Flow Nexus. Use the nextjs-starter template, configure environment variables, and verify the deployment is healthy.

prompt_templates.title: Monitor Resources
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the Flow Nexus system health, review sandbox status and logs, and list any running deployments.

prompt_templates.title: Full Platform Management
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the complete Flow Nexus platform workflow: authenticate, configure services, deploy an application, set up monitoring, and configure billing with auto-refill.

output_examples.input: Deploy a Next.js application to Flow Nexus and check its health
output: ✓ Health check passed - Application running on port 3000
✓ Monitoring configured with alerts for error rate and latency

best_practices: Always verify authentication before performing operations
Store platform configuration in version-controlled files
Use environment variables for sensitive credentials
Configure auto-refill to avoid service interruptions
anti_patterns: Hardcoding credentials in scripts or configuration files
Ignoring monitoring alerts or log warnings

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill supports Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires the Flow Nexus MCP server installed.

faq.question: What are the resource limits?
faq.answer: Default limits include 60 requests per minute, 1000MB storage, and 10 compute hours per user tier.

faq.question: How does MCP integration work?
faq.answer: The skill uses Flow Nexus MCP tools for all platform operations including auth, sandboxes, storage, and billing.

faq.question: Is my data safe with Flow Nexus?
faq.answer: Flow Nexus uses encrypted connections, sandbox isolation, and does not persist credentials beyond the session.

faq.question: Deployment failed, what do I check?
faq.answer: Verify credits balance, check sandbox logs for errors, ensure environment variables are set correctly, and confirm template availability.

faq.question: How is this different from other cloud skills?
faq.answer: Flow Nexus provides integrated sandboxes, storage, databases, and workflows in one platform with unified MCP access.
